title: List of reptiles and amphibians
data:
***Version [0.28](/0.28 "0.28")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

While most adventurers dream of engaging in thrilling battle with [dragons](/List_of_dragons "List of dragons"), the many **reptiles and amphibians** of the [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon") are still fierce foes for the aspiring hero. While they don't have any breath weapons, their bites are usually dangerous, and many of them are comfortable swimming through [water](/Water "Water"). Fortunately, they are all [cold-blooded](/Cold-blooded "Cold-blooded"), making [cold](/Cold "Cold") damage particularly useful for fighting them.

Reptiles and amphibians are most common around the [Lair](/Lair "Lair") and its branches, being replaced by greater, more intelligent threats later in the dungeon. The [Snake Pit](/Snake_Pit "Snake Pit") is, unsurprisingly, full of snakes in addition to their [snakemen](/List_of_nagas "List of nagas") masters.

## Contents

- [1 Amphibian Types](#Amphibian_Types)
  - [1.1 Unique Amphibian](#Unique_Amphibian)
- [2 Lizard Types](#Lizard_Types)
- [3 Snake Types](#Snake_Types)
  - [3.1 Unique Snake](#Unique_Snake)
- [4 Turtle Types](#Turtle_Types)
- [5 Other Reptiles](#Other_Reptiles)
  - [5.1 Unique Hydra](#Unique_Hydra)
- [6 Retired Reptiles and Amphibians](#Retired_Reptiles_and_Amphibians)

## Amphibian Types

F [![Bullfrog.png](/images/d/da/Bullfrog.png)](/File:Bullfrog.png) **[Bullfrog](/Bullfrog "Bullfrog")** - Although fast, these oversized frogs are more often delicacies than dangers.

F [![Cane toad.png](/images/b/bf/Cane_toad.png)](/File:Cane_toad.png) **[Cane toad](/Cane_toad "Cane toad")** - Slower and tougher than frogs, their powerful attacks are laced with deadly [poison](/Poison "Poison").

F [![Blink frog.png](/images/2/24/Blink_frog.png)](/File:Blink_frog.png) **[Blink frog](/Blink_frog "Blink frog")** - Interdimensional pack hunters who swarm and devour careless players while [blinking](/Blink "Blink") incessantly.

F [![Goliath frog.png](/images/5/50/Goliath_frog.png)](/File:Goliath_frog.png) **[Goliath frog](/Goliath_frog "Goliath frog")** - These [swamp](/Swamp "Swamp")-dwellers lash prey from afar with their [acidic](/Acid "Acid") tongues.

### Unique Amphibian

F [![Prince Ribbit.png](/images/8/87/Prince_Ribbit.png)](/File:Prince_Ribbit.png) **[Prince Ribbit](/Prince_Ribbit "Prince Ribbit")** - A human prince who was cursed to be a frog... and was also cursed to blink between dimensions? Regardless, he's got a vicious bite.

## Lizard Types

l [![Frilled lizard.png](/images/3/3a/Frilled_lizard.png)](/File:Frilled_lizard.png) **[Frilled lizard](/Frilled_lizard "Frilled lizard")** - One of the flimsiest opponents in the game, the only thing separating them from [rats](/Rat "Rat") is their ability to swim.

l [![Iguana.png](/images/a/af/Iguana.png)](/File:Iguana.png) **[Iguana](/Iguana "Iguana")** - These ill-tempered reptiles pack a bite worth keeping clear of.

l [![Basilisk.png](/images/b/b1/Basilisk.png)](/File:Basilisk.png) **[Basilisk](/Basilisk "Basilisk")** - Dreaded creatures of legend with a [petrifying](/Petrify "Petrify") gaze.

l [![Komodo dragon.png](/images/1/16/Komodo_dragon.png)](/File:Komodo_dragon.png) **[Komodo dragon](/Komodo_dragon "Komodo dragon")** - Oversized lizards with a particularly powerful bite.

l [![Alligator.png](/images/a/a4/Alligator.png)](/File:Alligator.png) **[Alligator](/Alligator "Alligator")** - Enormous beasts capable of surprising speed; their jaws and tail make short work of the poorly defended.

## Snake Types

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | "The latter lived in the country, and before his house there was an oak, in which there was a lair of snakes. His servants killed the snakes, but Melampus gathered wood and burnt the reptiles, and reared the young ones. And when the young were full grown, they stood beside him at each of his shoulders as he slept, and they purged his ears with their tongues. He started up in a great fright, but understood the voices of the birds flying overhead, and from what he learned from them he foretold to men what should come to pass."-Apollodorus (apocryphal), Library and Epitome, 1.9.11. circa 150 BC. Sir James George Frazer, translator.***"A snake, with mottles rare, Surveyed my chamber floor, In feature as the worm before, But ringed with power."-Emily Dickinson, "In Winter In My Room" |

S [![Ball python.png](/images/4/40/Ball_python.png)](/File:Ball_python.png) **[Ball python](/Ball_python "Ball python")**- A small constricting predator of vermin, they pose little threat to adventurers.

S [![Adder.png](/images/c/c2/Adder.png)](/File:Adder.png) **[Adder](/Adder "Adder")**- Although fragile, these snakes carry sufficient [venom](/Venom "Venom") to endanger low-level characters.

S [![Water moccasin.png](/images/f/fc/Water_moccasin.png)](/File:Water_moccasin.png) **[Water moccasin](/Water_moccasin "Water moccasin")**- Venomous, faster and hardier than an adder, but otherwise uninteresting.

S [![Black mamba.png](/images/2/26/Black_mamba.png)](/File:Black_mamba.png) **[Black mamba](/Black_mamba "Black mamba")**- Swift and [evasive](/Ev "Ev") killers with potent venom.

S [![Mana viper.png](/images/1/1d/Mana_viper.png)](/File:Mana_viper.png) **[Mana viper](/Mana_viper "Mana viper")**- Mystical snakes whose bites [drain magic](/Antimagic "Antimagic") from their victims.

S [![Sea snake.png](/images/f/f7/Sea_snake.png)](/File:Sea_snake.png) **[Sea snake](/Sea_snake "Sea snake")**- A brightly coloured snake that strikes with brutal venom. Fast on land and even faster in water.

S [![Shock serpent.png](/images/8/81/Shock_serpent.png)](/File:Shock_serpent.png) **[Shock serpent](/Shock_serpent "Shock serpent")**- Snakes that crackle with barely-contained electricity; they can launch bolts of lightning, but even hitting them results in a painful shock.

S [![Anaconda.png](/images/a/a4/Anaconda.png)](/File:Anaconda.png) **[Anaconda](/Anaconda "Anaconda")**- Enormous snakes that prefer to crush their prey to death instead of relying on venom.

S [![Guardian serpent.png](/images/3/32/Guardian_serpent.png)](/File:Guardian_serpent.png) **[Guardian serpent](/Guardian_serpent "Guardian serpent")**- Intelligent snakes with magical skills. Moderately dangerous alone, but can [teleport their allies](/Blink_Other_Close "Blink Other Close") to surround their foes.

S [![Lava snake.png](/images/b/b9/Lava_snake.png)](/File:Lava_snake.png) **[Lava snake](/Lava_snake "Lava snake")**- Unnatural magma-dwelling snakes that spit globs of molten stone at passing adventurers.

### Unique Snake

S [![Aizul.png](/images/b/be/Aizul.png)](/File:Aizul.png) **[Aizul](/Aizul "Aizul")**- A dishonoured guardian serpent who fell asleep on the job. She will happily put adventurers to sleep before blasting them with poison.

## Turtle Types

t [![Snapping turtle.png](/images/7/7b/Snapping_turtle.png)](/File:Snapping_turtle.png) **[Snapping turtle](/Snapping_turtle "Snapping turtle")** - Found in [the Shoals](/The_Shoals "The Shoals"), these sturdy creatures can stretch their necks to bite from a distance.

t [![Alligator snapping turtle.png](/images/f/f6/Alligator_snapping_turtle.png)](/File:Alligator_snapping_turtle.png) **[Alligator snapping turtle](/Alligator_snapping_turtle "Alligator snapping turtle")** - A significantly deadlier and more durable version of the snapping turtle.

## Other Reptiles

l [![Wyvern.png](/images/c/c1/Wyvern.png)](/File:Wyvern.png) **[Wyvern](/Wyvern "Wyvern")** - Swift, winged reptiles that resemble [dragonkind](/List_of_dragons "List of dragons") but are not truly draconic. They rely on their powerful jaws instead of a breath weapon.

D [![Hydra.png](/images/9/9d/Hydra.png)](/File:Hydra.png) **[Hydra](/Hydra "Hydra")** - Many-headed reptilian horrors that have devoured countless incautious heroes -- as the saying goes, "Cut off one head, two more take its place..."

### Unique Hydra

D [![The Lernaean hydra.png](/images/4/49/The_Lernaean_hydra.png)](/File:The_Lernaean_hydra.png) **[The Lernaean hydra](/The_Lernaean_hydra "The Lernaean hydra")** - Adventurers seeking the [Swamp](/Swamp "Swamp")'s [rune](/Rune_of_Zot "Rune of Zot") may instead find themselves facing [27](/27 "27") heads of gnashing fury.

## Retired Reptiles and Amphibians

l [![Leopard gecko.png](/images/c/c9/Leopard_gecko.png)](/File:Leopard_gecko.png) **[Leopard gecko](/Leopard_gecko "Leopard gecko")** - Faster, tougher, and stronger than frilled lizards, they were among the most dangerous animals found on D:1. Removed in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27").

l [![Crocodile.png](/images/d/d6/Crocodile.png)](/File:Crocodile.png) **[Crocodile](/Crocodile "Crocodile")** - Unimaginative biters which hung around [the Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair"). Removed in [0.26](/0.26 "0.26").

t [![Baby alligator.png](/images/0/07/Baby_alligator.png)](/File:Baby_alligator.png) **[Baby alligator](/Baby_alligator "Baby alligator")** - Significantly less dangerous than their mama, though she was often found nearby. Removed in [0.17](/0.17 "0.17").

F [![Giant toad.png](/images/4/47/Giant_toad.png)](/File:Giant_toad.png) **[Giant toad](/Giant_toad "Giant toad")** - Almost identical to a giant frog. Removed in [0.10](/0.10 "0.10").

S [![Viper.png](/images/9/99/Viper.png)](/File:Viper.png) **[Viper](/Viper "Viper")**- A bit sturdier than water moccasins, but a bit slower. Removed in [0.10](/0.10 "0.10").

l [![Gila monster.png](/images/5/54/Gila_monster.png)](/File:Gila_monster.png) **[Gila monster](/Gila_monster "Gila monster")** - A large lizard with [poisonous](/Poison "Poison") flesh. Removed in [0.9](/0.9 "0.9").
html:
List of reptiles and amphibians

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.28: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

While most adventurers dream of engaging in thrilling battle with dragons, the many reptiles and amphibians of the Dungeon are still fierce foes for the aspiring hero. While they don't have any breath weapons, their bites are usually dangerous, and many of them are comfortable swimming through water. Fortunately, they are all cold-blooded, making cold damage particularly useful for fighting them.

Reptiles and amphibians are most common around the Lair and its branches, being replaced by greater, more intelligent threats later in the dungeon. The Snake Pit is, unsurprisingly, full of snakes in addition to their snakemen masters.

Contents

  • 1 Amphibian Types
    • 1.1 Unique Amphibian
  • 2 Lizard Types
  • 3 Snake Types
    • 3.1 Unique Snake
  • 4 Turtle Types
  • 5 Other Reptiles
    • 5.1 Unique Hydra
  • 6 Retired Reptiles and Amphibians

Amphibian Types

F Bullfrog - Although fast, these oversized frogs are more often delicacies than dangers.

F Cane toad - Slower and tougher than frogs, their powerful attacks are laced with deadly poison.

F Blink frog - Interdimensional pack hunters who swarm and devour careless players while blinking incessantly.

F Goliath frog - These swamp-dwellers lash prey from afar with their acidic tongues.

Unique Amphibian

F Prince Ribbit - A human prince who was cursed to be a frog... and was also cursed to blink between dimensions? Regardless, he's got a vicious bite.

Lizard Types

l Frilled lizard - One of the flimsiest opponents in the game, the only thing separating them from rats is their ability to swim.

l Iguana - These ill-tempered reptiles pack a bite worth keeping clear of.

l Basilisk - Dreaded creatures of legend with a petrifying gaze.

l Komodo dragon - Oversized lizards with a particularly powerful bite.

l Alligator - Enormous beasts capable of surprising speed; their jaws and tail make short work of the poorly defended.

Snake Types

"The latter lived in the country, and before his house there was an oak, in which there was a lair of snakes. His servants killed the snakes, but Melampus gathered wood and burnt the reptiles, and reared the young ones. And when the young were full grown, they stood beside him at each of his shoulders as he slept, and they purged his ears with their tongues. He started up in a great fright, but understood the voices of the birds flying overhead, and from what he learned from them he foretold to men what should come to pass."

-Apollodorus (apocryphal), Library and Epitome, 1.9.11. circa 150 BC. Sir James George Frazer, translator.

"A snake, with mottles rare,
Surveyed my chamber floor,
In feature as the worm before,
But ringed with power."

-Emily Dickinson, "In Winter In My Room"

S Ball python- A small constricting predator of vermin, they pose little threat to adventurers.

S Adder- Although fragile, these snakes carry sufficient venom to endanger low-level characters.

S Water moccasin- Venomous, faster and hardier than an adder, but otherwise uninteresting.

S Black mamba- Swift and evasive killers with potent venom.

S Mana viper- Mystical snakes whose bites drain magic from their victims.

S Sea snake- A brightly coloured snake that strikes with brutal venom. Fast on land and even faster in water.

S Shock serpent- Snakes that crackle with barely-contained electricity; they can launch bolts of lightning, but even hitting them results in a painful shock.

S Anaconda- Enormous snakes that prefer to crush their prey to death instead of relying on venom.

S Guardian serpent- Intelligent snakes with magical skills. Moderately dangerous alone, but can teleport their allies to surround their foes.

S Lava snake- Unnatural magma-dwelling snakes that spit globs of molten stone at passing adventurers.

Unique Snake

S Aizul- A dishonoured guardian serpent who fell asleep on the job. She will happily put adventurers to sleep before blasting them with poison.

Turtle Types

t Snapping turtle - Found in the Shoals, these sturdy creatures can stretch their necks to bite from a distance.

t Alligator snapping turtle - A significantly deadlier and more durable version of the snapping turtle.

Other Reptiles

l Wyvern - Swift, winged reptiles that resemble dragonkind but are not truly draconic. They rely on their powerful jaws instead of a breath weapon.

D Hydra - Many-headed reptilian horrors that have devoured countless incautious heroes -- as the saying goes, "Cut off one head, two more take its place..."

Unique Hydra

D The Lernaean hydra - Adventurers seeking the Swamp's rune may instead find themselves facing 27 heads of gnashing fury.

Retired Reptiles and Amphibians

l Leopard gecko - Faster, tougher, and stronger than frilled lizards, they were among the most dangerous animals found on D:1. Removed in 0.27.

l Crocodile - Unimaginative biters which hung around the Lair. Removed in 0.26.

t Baby alligator - Significantly less dangerous than their mama, though she was often found nearby. Removed in 0.17.

F Giant toad - Almost identical to a giant frog. Removed in 0.10.

S Viper- A bit sturdier than water moccasins, but a bit slower. Removed in 0.10.

l Gila monster - A large lizard with poisonous flesh. Removed in 0.9.

Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=List_of_reptiles_and_amphibians&oldid=62213"

{{version028}} While most adventurers dream of engaging in thrilling battle with [[list of dragons|dragons]], the many '''reptiles and amphibians''' of the [[Dungeon]] are still fierce foes for the aspiring hero. While they don't have any breath weapons, their bites are usually dangerous, and many of them are comfortable swimming through [[water]]. Fortunately, they are all [[cold-blooded]], making [[cold]] damage particularly useful for fighting them. Reptiles and amphibians are most common around the [[Lair]] and its branches, being replaced by greater, more intelligent threats later in the dungeon. The [[Snake Pit]] is, unsurprisingly, full of snakes in addition to their [[list of nagas|snakemen]] masters. ==Amphibian Types== {{monsterlink|Bullfrog}} - Although fast, these oversized frogs are more often delicacies than dangers. {{monsterlink|Cane toad}} - Slower and tougher than frogs, their powerful attacks are laced with deadly [[poison]]. {{monsterlink|Blink frog}} - Interdimensional pack hunters who swarm and devour careless players while [[blink]]ing incessantly. {{monsterlink|Goliath frog}} - These [[swamp]]-dwellers lash prey from afar with their [[acid]]ic tongues.
===Unique Amphibian=== {{monsterlink|Prince Ribbit}} - A human prince who was cursed to be a frog... and was also cursed to blink between dimensions? Regardless, he's got a vicious bite. ==Lizard Types== {{monsterlink|Frilled lizard}} - One of the flimsiest opponents in the game, the only thing separating them from [[rat]]s is their ability to swim. {{monsterlink|Iguana}} - These ill-tempered reptiles pack a bite worth keeping clear of. {{monsterlink|Basilisk}} - Dreaded creatures of legend with a [[petrify]]ing gaze. {{monsterlink|Komodo dragon}} - Oversized lizards with a particularly powerful bite. {{monsterlink|Alligator}} - Enormous beasts capable of surprising speed; their jaws and tail make short work of the poorly defended. ==Snake Types== {{flavour|"The latter lived in the country, and before his house there was an oak, in which there was a lair of snakes. His servants killed the snakes, but Melampus gathered wood and burnt the reptiles, and reared the young ones. And when the young were full grown, they stood beside him at each of his shoulders as he slept, and they purged his ears with their tongues. He started up in a great fright, but understood the voices of the birds flying overhead, and from what he learned from them he foretold to men what should come to pass." -Apollodorus (apocryphal), Library and Epitome, 1.9.11. circa 150 BC. Sir James George Frazer, translator. ---- "A snake, with mottles rare,
Surveyed my chamber floor,
In feature as the worm before,
But ringed with power." -Emily Dickinson, "In Winter In My Room"}} {{monsterlink|Ball python}}- A small constricting predator of vermin, they pose little threat to adventurers. {{monsterlink|Adder}}- Although fragile, these snakes carry sufficient [[venom]] to endanger low-level characters. {{monsterlink|Water moccasin}}- Venomous, faster and hardier than an adder, but otherwise uninteresting. {{monsterlink|Black mamba}}- Swift and [[ev]]asive killers with potent venom. {{monsterlink|Mana viper}}- Mystical snakes whose bites [[antimagic|drain magic]] from their victims. {{monsterlink|Sea snake}}- A brightly coloured snake that strikes with brutal venom. Fast on land and even faster in water. {{monsterlink|Shock serpent}}- Snakes that crackle with barely-contained electricity; they can launch bolts of lightning, but even hitting them results in a painful shock. {{monsterlink|Anaconda}}- Enormous snakes that prefer to crush their prey to death instead of relying on venom. {{monsterlink|Guardian serpent}}- Intelligent snakes with magical skills. Moderately dangerous alone, but can [[Blink Other Close|teleport their allies]] to surround their foes. {{monsterlink|Lava snake}}- Unnatural magma-dwelling snakes that spit globs of molten stone at passing adventurers. ===Unique Snake=== {{monsterlink|Aizul}}- A dishonoured guardian serpent who fell asleep on the job. She will happily put adventurers to sleep before blasting them with poison. ==Turtle Types== {{monsterlink|Snapping turtle}} - Found in [[the Shoals]], these sturdy creatures can stretch their necks to bite from a distance. {{monsterlink|Alligator snapping turtle}} - A significantly deadlier and more durable version of the snapping turtle. ==Other Reptiles== {{monsterlink|Wyvern}} - Swift, winged reptiles that resemble [[list of dragons|dragonkind]] but are not truly draconic. They rely on their powerful jaws instead of a breath weapon. {{monsterlink|Hydra}} - Many-headed reptilian horrors that have devoured countless incautious heroes -- as the saying goes, "Cut off one head, two more take its place..." ===Unique Hydra=== {{monsterlink|The Lernaean hydra}} - Adventurers seeking the [[Swamp]]'s [[rune of Zot|rune]] may instead find themselves facing [[27]] heads of gnashing fury. ==Retired Reptiles and Amphibians== {{monsterlink|Leopard gecko}} - Faster, tougher, and stronger than frilled lizards, they were among the most dangerous animals found on D:1. Removed in [[0.27]]. {{monsterlink|Crocodile}} - Unimaginative biters which hung around [[the Lair]]. Removed in [[0.26]]. {{monsterlink|Baby alligator}} - Significantly less dangerous than their mama, though she was often found nearby. Removed in [[0.17]]. {{monsterlink|Giant toad}} - Almost identical to a giant frog. Removed in [[0.10]]. {{monsterlink|Viper}}- A bit sturdier than water moccasins, but a bit slower. Removed in [[0.10]]. {{monsterlink|Gila monster}} - A large lizard with [[poison]]ous flesh. Removed in [[0.9]]. [[Category:Lists of monsters]]
